Class Peer

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      Peer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class Peer
extends java.lang.Thread

The peer class maintains a connection for a peer, peer state, and peer data

Constructor Detail

Peer

public Peer(java.lang.String peerID,
            java.lang.String ip,
            int port,
            int numPieces,
            Torrent torrent)
creates a peer object. We use this constructor whenever we are connecting to a peer.

Parameters:
peerID - the peerId of this peer
ip - the ip address of this peer
port - the port number of this peer
numPieces - the number of pieces in the torrent
torrent - the torrent that is associated with this peer

Peer

public Peer(java.net.Socket connection,
            Torrent torrent)
Creates a peer object. We use this constructor whenever a peer is connecting to us

Parameters:
connection - the socket associated with the incoming peer
torrent - the torrent associated with this peer

public void run()
Listens for messages from a peer and handles them.

Specified by:

Overrides:

initiateHandshake

public boolean initiateHandshake(java.lang.String localPeerID,
                                 java.nio.ByteBuffer info_hash)
InitiateHandshake is called when we are connecting to another peer and sending the handshake.

Parameters:
localPeerID - the peerID of the client
info_hash - the info_hash of the client
Returns:
true if the handshake is verified, otherwise false

answerHandshake

public boolean answerHandshake(java.lang.String localPeerID,
                               java.nio.ByteBuffer info_hash)
AnswerHandshake is called when we need to respond to a connecting peer's handshake.

Parameters:
localPeerID - the peerID of the client
info_hash - the info_hash of the client
Returns:
true if the handshake is successful, otherwise false

sendBitfieldMessage

public void sendBitfieldMessage(byte[] bitfield)
                         throws java.io.IOException
Sends a bitfield message to this peer

Parameters:

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem writing the data to the output stream

sendRequestMessage

public void sendRequestMessage(int index,
                               int pieceOffset,
                               int requestLength)
                        throws java.io.IOException
Sends a request message to this peer

Parameters:
index - The zero-based piece index denoting the piece requested
pieceOffset - The zero-based byte offset within the piece requested
requestLength - The number of bytes requested
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem writing the data to the output stream

requestNext

public void requestNext()
RequestNext grabs the next message out of pending Request and adds it to pOutThreads message queue.

startRequests

public void startRequests()
StartRequests adds the first message in this Peer's pending request queue to pOutThreads message queue.

Sends a have message to this peer

Parameters:
index - the index of the piece that the client has

java.io.IOException - if there is a problem writing the data to the output stream

sendPieceMessage

public void sendPieceMessage(int index,
                             int begin,
                             byte[] data)
Sends a piece message to this peer

Parameters:
index - zero-based integer specifying which piece is being sent
begin - zero-based integer specifying the offset within a piece
data - byte array that contains the data block of the piece
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem writing the data to the output stream

setCompletedFromBitfield

public void setCompletedFromBitfield(byte[] bitfield)
Syncs this Peer objects CompletedPieces boolean array with a given bitfield

Parameters:
bitfield - byte array recieved from peer that contains which pieces the peer has

setCompletedByIndex

public void setCompletedByIndex(int pieceIndex)
Sets the completedPieces boolean array to true based on the given index.
This function will be used when receiving have messages instead of a bitfield.

Parameters:
pieceIndex - the index in the boolean array will be set to true

getHaves

public boolean[] getHaves()
Returns the boolean array that represents which pieces this peer has

Returns:
the boolean array where if an index is true, the peer has that piece, and if the index is false, the peer does not have that piece

printHaves

public void printHaves()
Prints which pieces the peer has

isConnected

public boolean isConnected()
Returns whether or not the client is connected to this peer

Returns:
true if the client is connected to the peer, otherwise false

the message queue of this peers PeerOutThread
